description: Middle English, from Old French julep, from Medieval Latin julapium, via Arabic جُلَاب‎ (julāb) from Persian گلاب‎ (golâb, “rosewater”), from گل‎ (“rose”) + آب‎ (“water”).

entries.meaning: A refreshing drink flavored with aromatic herbs, especially mint, and sometimes alcohol.
(historical, medicine) A pleasant-tasting liquid medicine in which other nauseous medicines are taken.
